text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the T-shirt with the workers' rights message would be considered a copyright violation *as (most likely) a violation of the right of integrity in Italy*. The candidate answer discusses this shirt under the heading '2. Worker's rights advocate version' and concludes it is 'Potentially infringement, but parody defense possible.' It cites Article 18 (which covers moral rights, including integrity) but frames the analysis around whether the parody defense applies, rather than explicitly stating it is a violation of the right of integrity. While the right of integrity is implicated when unauthorized modifications are made, the response focuses on the defense (parody) rather than confirming the violation under the specific right mentioned in the criterion (integrity).
